1.q_string: Which of the following is not a thermodynamic coordinate?

q_option: X-Backward reaction; Y - Forward reaction; Z - Products
X - Forward reaction; Y - Backward reaction; Z - Equilibrium
X - Reversible reaction; Y - Irreversible reaction; Z - Equilibrium
X-Forward reaction; Y- Forward reaction; Z - Backward reaction
1.q_string: Study the given figure and label X, Y and Z.

q_option: Initial and final enthalpy change of a reaction.
1.q_string: The enthalpy change of a reaction does not depend upon:

What is the enthalpy change for the given reaction, if enthalpies of formation of \({Al}_{2} {O}_{3}\) and \({Fe}_{2} {O}_{3}\) are \(-1670 {~k} {J} {~mol}^{-1}\) and \(-834 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) respectively. 

\({Fe}_{2} {O}_{3}+2 {Al} \rightarrow {Al}_{2} {O}_{3}+2 {Fe}\)

q_option: When work is done by the system: \(\Delta U=q+w\)
1.q_string: According to the first law of thermodynamics, \(\Delta U=q+w\). In special cases the statement can be expressed in different ways. Which of the following is not a correct expression?
The statement "The change of enthalpy of a chemical reaction is same whether the reaction takes place in one or several steps" is:
Hess's law is applicable for the determination of heat of ________.

q_option: \(\Delta H\) is the net heat absorbed from the surroundings.
\(\Delta H\) is the net heat given to the surroundings.
\(\Delta H\) is positive for the reaction.
\(\Delta H\) is the total energy possessed by the reactants.
1.q_string: Study the given graph and choose the correct option.

What will be \(\Delta H\) for the reaction,

\({CH}_{2} {Cl}_{2} \rightarrow {C}+2 {H}+2 {Cl}\)?

(B.E. of C - H and C - Cl bonds are \(416 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) and \(325 {~kJ~mol}^{-1}\) respectively)

Bond energies of some bonds are given below: 

\({Cl}-{Cl}=242.8 {~k} {J} {~mol}^{-1}\)

\({H}-{Cl}=431.8 {~k} {J} {~mol}^{-1}\) 

\({O}-{H}=464 {~k} {J} ~mol^{-1}\) 

\({O}={O}=442 {~k} {J} {~mol}^{-1}\)

Using the B.E.s given, calculate \(\Delta H\) for the given reaction: 

\(2 {Cl}_{2}+2 {H}_{2} {O} \rightarrow 4 {HCl}+{O}_{2}\)

For a reaction: \(X \rightarrow Y+Z\)

Absolute entropies of \(X, Y, Z\) are \(120 \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}, 213.8 \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) and \(197.9 \mathrm{~J}\) \(K^{-1} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) respectively.

What will be the entropy change of the reaction at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\) and 1 atm?

Which of the following reactions will have a negative \(\Delta S\)?
What will be the signs of \(\Delta \mathrm{H}\) and \(\Delta \mathrm{S}\) (respectively), when \(\mathrm{NaOH}\) is dissolved in water?

q_option: The presence of reaction species in a covered beaker is an example of open system.
There is an exchange of energy as well as matter between the system and the surroundings in a closed system.
The presence of reactants in a closed vessel made up of copper is an example of a closed system.
The presence of reactants in a thermos flask or any other closed, insulated vessel is an example of a closed system.
1.q_string: Which of the following statement is correct?
Five moles of a gas is put through a series of changes as shown graphically in a cyclic process. The processes \(A \rightarrow B, B \rightarrow C\) and \(C \rightarrow A\) respectively are?
Three stars \(A, B, C\) have surface temperatures \(T_{A}, T_{B}\) and \(T_{C}\). \(A\) appears bluish, \(B\) appears reddish and \(C\) appears yellowish. We can conclude that:
At absolute zero, the entropy of a pure crystal is zero. This is:

q_option: Same in I and II but not in III and IV
Same in III and IV but not in I and II
Same in I, II and III but not in IV
Same in all of the four cases
1.q_string: An ideal gas is undergoing a change of state from A to B through four different paths I, II, III, and IV as shown in the P-V diagram that lead to the same change of state, then the change in internal energy is:
\(1 {~kg}\) of water is heated from \(40K\) to \(70K\). If its volume remains constant, then the change in internal energy is (specific heat of water \(=4148 {~J} {~kg}^{-1} {~K}^{-1}\) )

Two bars of same length and same cross-sectional area but of different thermal conductivities \(K_{1}\) and \(K_{2}\) are joined end to end as shown in the figure. One end of the compound bar is at temperature \(T_{1}\) and the opposite end at temperature \(T_{2}\) (where \(T_{1}>T_{2}\) ).

The temperature of the junction is:
1g mole of an ideal gas STP is subjected to a reversible adiabatic expansion to double its volume. The change in internal energy \((\gamma=1.4)\)

[B.E. of \(N-H, H-H, N \equiv N\) is \(389 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}, 435 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}, 945.36 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) respectively]

For combustion of 1 mole of benzene at \(25^{\circ} C\), the heat of reaction at constant pressure is \(-780.9 {~kcal}\). What will be the heat of reaction at constant volume?

 \(C_{6} H_{6(l)}+7 \frac{1}{2} {O}_{2(g)} \rightarrow 6 {CO}_{2(g)}+3 {H}_{2} {O}_{(l)}\)

Reaction of methanol with dioxygen was carried out and \(\Delta U\) was found to be-

\(726 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) at \(298 {~K}\). The enthalpy change for the reaction will be: 

\({CH}_{3} {OH}_{(l)}+\frac{3}{2} {O}_{2({g})} \rightarrow {CO}_{2({g})}+2 {H}_{2} {O}_{(l)} \Delta H=-726 {~KJ~mol}^{(-1)}\)

The molar heat capacity of water at constant pressure, \(C_{{p}}\) is \(75 {~J} {~K}^{-1}\) mol \(^{-1}\). When \(10 {~KJ}\) of heat is supplied to \(1 {~kg}\) water which is free to expand, the increase in temperature of water is:

Two reactions are given below:

\(C_{(\text {graphite})}+O_{2(g)} \rightarrow C O_{2(g)} ; \Delta H=-393.7 k J\)

\(C_{(\text {diamond})} \rightarrow C_{\text {(graphite})} ; \Delta H=-2.1 {~kJ}\)

What quantity of diamond will give \(800 {~kJ}\) of heat on burning?

\(2 F e_{(a q)}^{3+}+2 I^{-}_{({a q})} \rightarrow 2 F e_{(a q)}^{2+}+I_{2(s)}\) has \(E_{\text {cell }}^{o}=0.236 V\) at \(298 ~K\)
